title: Drawing, "Recto Title: Page of a sketchbook showing two scenes, one including the Blinding of Cyclops.", ca. 1590
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, on laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical rectangle.  Recto, top: Scene in cave of Cyclops, the giant in the foreground lying on his side, his head supported by his left hand.  A group of men are blinding his single eye with a spear.  Flock of Cyclops in background; below: A group of figures stand around a stone platform on which lies a man who is being eaten by an animal.  Verso, Figures in a grotto, at right.  Prow of ship at left.  Other figures on incline, left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Recto Title: Page of a sketchbook showing two scenes, one including the Blinding of Cyclops.", ca. 1590.
ca. 1590. Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-146.
